entry.title: Sweeps Scheduled for Tuesday (9/29) and Wednesday (9/30): When...
entry.content:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

Sweeps Scheduled for Tuesday (9/29) and Wednesday (9/30): When will this Move along To NOWHERE End…

There are two more sites where people without housing live that are slated to be swept next week. 21st and Market/Blake is currently home to about 60 people without housing - some of whom have been living for months, some who moved there recently from the 22nd st sweep or the 25th st sweep. This site was posted for a sweep the same day as residents from 25th and Arapahoe moved ...to this site in search of anywhere to be. 25th and Welton is currently home to another 60 or so people without housing. Most of the residents on the right of way strip on 25th have been living there for many months. Others living in the parking lot area have moved there recently after other sweeps.

Residents of these encampments all ask the same question: where are we supposed to go?? The City has done nothing to get these people access to housing. They are not even being offered hotel rooms through the COVID FEMA funding. They are being told to either go to a shelter or go to jail.

Come support residents of these encampments as they demand real housing or places where they are allowed to survive.

Bring the following things to assist residents:

-Truck, or any vehicle to help move

-Carts

-Bungee Cords/Rope

-Trash Bags

-Food

-Coffee/CoCo

-Water

Your assistance is much appreciated! Somewhere around 7am and all morning help will likely be needed.

Toward Rights, Dignity and Housing…

See More

entry.title: City Trying to Add Two Areas for Permanent Sweeps The...
entry.content:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

City Trying to Add Two Areas for Permanent Sweeps

The settlement for the class action lawsuit against the City for the seizure of property without due process (Lyall v City of Denver) included a compromise. In order to get the City to agree to 7 day notices for large encampments across the city, they required an agreement that the area around the Rescue Mission and Samaritan House (also known as the Triangle) be a daily sweep area - meaning City crews could sweep that area M...onday through Friday any time of the morning without needing to post a 7 day or 48 hour notice. This is the only area in the city that has this exception. Everywhere else the City must post proper notice before seizing property.

Since then, this Triangle area that was the hub street of homelessness for years is empty of people surviving there due to these regular sweeps.

Now, the City is trying to add two areas to this “exception” - making them essentially closed off from anyone resting there with property. The areas are around Park Ave, Stout, and 22nd, and around 25th, Arapahoe, and Lawrence (we are still waiting to get details from the city on the exact blocks proposed). If turned into what the City calls “regular cleaning sites,” this would permanently prevent anyone from being able to survive in those areas by enabling the City to seize any property from that area without notice.

The lawsuit agreement requires the City bring any proposed new areas for regular sweeps to the homelessness advisory group (a quarterly meeting the City must hold with people who are homeless to hear input on issues or proposed changes). At the most recent homelessness advisory meeting held on September 21st, the City brought this proposed addition of regular sweep spots to the meeting but presented it as if it were an update. When we asked the homeless community present at the meeting directly whether they support these additional sweep areas or not, every single person raised their hand to oppose adding these areas.

The City cannot go forward adding permanent sweep areas without the agreement of the homeless class the settlement was made with. The City does not have unilateral say here. There was an agreement made with the homeless community and that agreement must be respected.

See More

entry.title: The article is few months old (May) but there is no reason we...
entry.content:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

The article is few months old (May) but there is no reason we could not have had our own sanctioned tent encampments. We have connections with outreach workers in SF and they tell us that in the areas where they have created these encampment Sweeps just outside the camps have increased dramatically.

Even so, it is a far cry better than folks lined up along the sidewalks. Our Mayor would rather scatter our homeless and create controversy and free press by being mean. It is no...t helping but several dozen of these camps will help. If we would just do it. for all those "We can Do Better" folks why aren't you?
List your excuses below.

https://sf.curbed.com/…/tent-city-sf-san-francisco-coronavi…

See MoreWith more to come

sf.curbed.com

SF’s first sanctioned tent city provides safe—albeit temporary—shelter during pandemic

With more to comeWith more to come

entry.title: Public hearing on Oct 12. Let us see if the real-estate lobby,...
entry.content:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

Public hearing on Oct 12.
Let us see if the real-estate lobby, the ones who have tried to buy off council members, come out opposed. Council will need some backbone on this one to make the needed change. Because you know despite what he says publicly the Mayor will veto it so a super majority in council is needed. Even then they have flip-flopped after a Mayoral Veto in the past.
Remember the Denver Post Building vote?
Remember the amendments to last years budget?
Lets not get too excited here.

The Denver City Council is considering a temporary zoning amendment that would liberate land restricted under “old” zoning code for emergency uses, such as city-sanctioned homeless encampments and outdoor expansions

coloradopolitics.com

Denver clears path for zoning change that could free up land for managed homeless campsites

entry.title: Residents of Encampment at 25th and Arapahoe make Three Demands...
entry.content:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

Residents of Encampment at 25th and Arapahoe make Three Demands of the City Before Sweep Set for Tuesday

Moving Support Needed On Tuesday: Please Come (see details below)

Residents of this encampment are demanding that City officials choice between the following options:

...

Provide housing or hotel rooms to all residents of this encampment (at least through winter...but then with permanent housing connection)

Open an SOS site in the area immediately where all residents of this encampment can stay

Let former residents of this encampment be (without sweeps and police) wherever reasonable spots they move to

Email mayorsoffice@denvergov.org and join the residents in making these demands!

Moving Support Needed

Please come to 25th and Arapahoe and Lawrence on Tuesday morning to help residents who are moving. Bring any or all of the following:

-Truck, or any vehicle to help move

-Carts

-Bungee Cords

-Rope

-Trash Bags

-Food

-Coffee/CoCo

-Water

Your assistance is much appreciated! Somewhere around 7am and all morning help will likely be needed.

See More

entry.title: Residents of Encampment at 25th and Arapahoe make Three Demands...
entry.content:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

Residents of Encampment at 25th and Arapahoe make Three Demands of the City Before Sweep Set for Tuesday

The City has rescheduled the sweep of 25th and Arapahoe/Lawrence for this Tuesday, September 22nd. Since in person school is scheduled to start at that location on September 28th, most residents of this encampment believe it might not be the best place to stay once school is in session. However, this does not mean the 60 or more residents of this camp can be expected to ju...st disappear with this sweep.

Residents of this encampment are demanding that City officials choice between the following options:

Provide housing or hotel rooms to all residents of this encampment (at least through winter...but then with permanent housing connection)

Open an SOS site in the area immediately where all residents of this encampment can stay

Let former residents of this encampment be (without sweeps and police) wherever reasonable spots they move to

The City should reply to residents with which option they are choosing by Monday (9/21) so residents know where they will be moving to on Tuesday. City officials can make this announcement directly delivered to the camp in writing, or send it to info@denverhomelessoutloud.org and we will deliver it to residents for the City.

If the City needs assistance finding housing or hotels for the roughly 60 residents of this encampment, they need look no farther than the thousands of vacant luxury apartments and hotels. The City can hold master leases on apartments and rent those to people according to their income. They can also set up long term leases at hotels as they move forward in buying vacant hotels.

Homelessness ends with a home. This is possible. The time is now. The residents of 25th and Arapahoe are waiting...

See More
